title: Normalize invite code submission and clarify case-insensitive global invite code during onboarding

requirements.summary: Trim invite codes before submission and add helper text indicating the global invite code is not case-sensitive on the onboarding invite step.
acceptanceCriteria: Submitting the invite step always sends a trimmed invite code value (no leading/trailing whitespace) to the backend.
The invite step displays English helper text that clearly states the invite code is not case-sensitive.
The existing error message shown for invalid invite codes remains in English: "The invite code you entered is invalid. Please check and try again."

file_operations.description: Ensure invite submission always uses a trimmed invite code via the existing normalizeInviteCode flow, and add concise English helper text under the Invite Code input indicating the global invite code is not case-sensitive. Keep the existing invalid-invite error copy unchanged.
Confirm normalizeInviteCode consistently trims leading/trailing whitespace and is the single normalization utility used by onboarding invite submission (no change to user-facing text).
